body:
This issue was noted in #11136.I  am trying to compile with the Intel compilers and specify a non-default gcc via the -gcc-name. However, it looks like adding -gcc-name to the cflags in compilers.yaml isn't taking effect. Instead it looks like it still uses the default gcc in my PATH which is version 4.9.3:

```
bash-4.2$ which gcc
/usr/tce/packages/gcc/gcc-4.9.3/bin/gcc
```

Here you can see my compiler configuration

```
bash-4.2$ ./bin/spack compiler info intel@19.0.3
intel@19.0.3.199:
        paths:
                cc = /usr/WS2/lee218/spack.pr11136/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-7.1.0/intel-parallel-studio-professional.2019.3-vk3e2ynjjin3uxutw63qy76fs5bgu7lu/bin/icc
                cxx = /usr/WS2/lee218/spack.pr11136/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-7.1.0/intel-parallel-studio-professional.2019.3-vk3e2ynjjin3uxutw63qy76fs5bgu7lu/bin/icpc
                f77 = /usr/WS2/lee218/spack.pr11136/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-7.1.0/intel-parallel-studio-professional.2019.3-vk3e2ynjjin3uxutw63qy76fs5bgu7lu/bin/ifort
                fc = /usr/WS2/lee218/spack.pr11136/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-7.1.0/intel-parallel-studio-professional.2019.3-vk3e2ynjjin3uxutw63qy76fs5bgu7lu/bin/ifort
        flags:
                cxxflags = ['-gxx-name=/usr/tce/packages/gcc/gcc-7.1.0/bin/g++']
                fflags = ['-gcc-name=/usr/tce/packages/gcc/gcc-7.1.0/bin/gcc']
                cflags = ['-gcc-name=/usr/tce/packages/gcc/gcc-7.1.0/bin/gcc']
        modules  = []
        operating system  = rhel7
```

And notice in the icc-v output that the .o files and the lib directories are coming from the default 4.9.3 gcc installation:

```
bash-4.2$ ./bin/spack build-env zlib%intel@19.0.3 /usr/WS2/lee218/spack.pr11136/lib/spack/env/intel/icc -v
icc version 19.0.3.199 (gcc version 4.9.3 compatibility)
ld    /lib/../lib64/crt1.o /lib/../lib64/crti.o /usr/tce/packages/gcc/gcc-4.9.3/lib64/gcc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/4.9.3/crtbegin.o --eh-frame-hdr --build-id -dynamic-linker /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 -m elf_x86_64 -o a.out -L/usr/WS2/lee218/spack.pr11136/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-7.1.0/intel-parallel-studio-professional.2019.3-vk3e2ynjjin3uxutw63qy76fs5bgu7lu/compilers_and_libraries_2019.3.199/linux/compiler/lib/intel64_lin -L/usr/tce/packages/gcc/gcc-4.9.3/lib64/gcc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/4.9.3/ -L/usr/tce/packages/gcc/gcc-4.9.3/lib64/gcc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/4.9.3/../../../../lib64 -L/usr/tce/packages/gcc/gcc-4.9.3/lib64/gcc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/4.9.3/../../../../lib64/ -L/lib/../lib64 -L/lib/../lib64/ -L/usr/lib/../lib64 -L/usr/lib/../lib64/ -L/usr/tce/packages/gcc/gcc-4.9.3/lib64/gcc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/4.9.3/../../../ -L/lib64 -L/lib/ -L/usr/lib64 -L/usr/lib -rpath=/usr/WS2/lee218/spack.pr11136/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-7.1.0/intel-parallel-studio-professional.2019.3-vk3e2ynjjin3uxutw63qy76fs5bgu7lu/compilers_and_libraries_2019.3.199/linux/compiler/lib/intel64 -Bdynamic -Bstatic -limf -lsvml -lirng -Bdynamic -lm -Bstatic -lipgo -ldecimal --as-needed -Bdynamic -lcilkrts -lstdc++ --no-as-needed -lgcc -lgcc_s -Bstatic -lirc -lsvml -Bdynamic -lc -lgcc -lgcc_s -Bstatic -lirc_s -Bdynamic -ldl -lc /usr/tce/packages/gcc/gcc-4.9.3/lib64/gcc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/4.9.3/crtend.o /lib/../lib64/crtn.o
/lib/../lib64/crt1.o: In function `_start':
(.text+0x20): undefined reference to `main'
```

However, if I explicitly add -gcc-name, you can see that it finds the appropriate gcc-7.1.0 .o files and lib directories:

```
bash-4.2$ ./bin/spack build-env zlib%intel@19.0.3 /usr/WS2/lee218/spack.pr11136/lib/spack/env/intel/icc -gcc-name=/usr/tce/packages/gcc/gcc-7.1.0/bin/gcc -v
icc version 19.0.3.199 (gcc version 7.1.0 compatibility)
ld    /lib/../lib64/crt1.o /lib/../lib64/crti.o /usr/tce/packages/gcc/gcc-7.1.0/lib64/gcc/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/7.1.0/crtbegin.o --eh-frame-hdr --build-id -dynamic-linker /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 -m elf_x86_64 -o a.out -L/usr/WS2/lee218/spack.pr11136/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-7.1.0/intel-parallel-studio-professional.2019.3-vk3e2ynjjin3uxutw63qy76fs5bgu7lu/compilers_and_libraries_2019.3.199/linux/compiler/lib/intel64_lin -L/usr/tce/packages/gcc/gcc-7.1.0/lib64/gcc/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/7.1.0/ -L/usr/tce/packages/gcc/gcc-7.1.0/lib64/gcc/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/7.1.0/../../../../lib64 -L/usr/tce/packages/gcc/gcc-7.1.0/lib64/gcc/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/7.1.0/../../../../lib64/ -L/lib/../lib64 -L/lib/../lib64/ -L/usr/lib/../lib64 -L/usr/lib/../lib64/ -L/usr/tce/packages/gcc/gcc-7.1.0/lib64/gcc/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/7.1.0/../../../ -L/lib64 -L/lib/ -L/usr/lib64 -L/usr/lib -rpath=/usr/WS2/lee218/spack.pr11136/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-7.1.0/intel-parallel-studio-professional.2019.3-vk3e2ynjjin3uxutw63qy76fs5bgu7lu/compilers_and_libraries_2019.3.199/linux/compiler/lib/intel64 -Bdynamic -Bstatic -limf -lsvml -lirng -Bdynamic -lm -Bstatic -lipgo -ldecimal --as-needed -Bdynamic -lcilkrts -lstdc++ --no-as-needed -lgcc -lgcc_s -Bstatic -lirc -lsvml -Bdynamic -lc -lgcc -lgcc_s -Bstatic -lirc_s -Bdynamic -ldl -lc /usr/tce/packages/gcc/gcc-7.1.0/lib64/gcc/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/7.1.0/crtend.o /lib/../lib64/crtn.o
/lib/../lib64/crt1.o: In function `_start':
(.text+0x20): undefined reference to `main'
```

I can also see if I actually build zlib, that it does not pick up the gcc-7.1.0 .so's even though the build environment looks correct:

```
[lee218@rzwiz2:spack.pr11136]$ grep gcc-7.1.0 /usr/WS2/lee218/spack.pr11136/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/intel-19.0.3/zlib-1.2.11-hip2dpjyumeiunixdrsur6ptbz5zdvtr/.spack/build.env 
export SPACK_CC="/usr/WS2/lee218/spack.pr11136/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-7.1.0/intel-parallel-studio-professional.2019.3-vk3e2ynjjin3uxutw63qy76fs5bgu7lu/bin/icc"
export SPACK_CFLAGS="-gcc-name=/usr/tce/packages/gcc/gcc-7.1.0/bin/gcc"
export SPACK_CXX="/usr/WS2/lee218/spack.pr11136/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-7.1.0/intel-parallel-studio-professional.2019.3-vk3e2ynjjin3uxutw63qy76fs5bgu7lu/bin/icpc"
export SPACK_CXXFLAGS="-gxx-name=/usr/tce/packages/gcc/gcc-7.1.0/bin/g++"
export SPACK_F77="/usr/WS2/lee218/spack.pr11136/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-7.1.0/intel-parallel-studio-professional.2019.3-vk3e2ynjjin3uxutw63qy76fs5bgu7lu/bin/ifort"
export SPACK_FC="/usr/WS2/lee218/spack.pr11136/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-7.1.0/intel-parallel-studio-professional.2019.3-vk3e2ynjjin3uxutw63qy76fs5bgu7lu/bin/ifort"
export SPACK_FFLAGS="-gcc-name=/usr/tce/packages/gcc/gcc-7.1.0/bin/gcc"
```
```
bash-4.2$ ldd opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/intel-19.0.3/zlib-1.2.11-hip2dpjyumeiunixdrsur6ptbz5zdvtr/lib/libz.so | grep libgcc
        libgcc_s.so.1 => /lib64/libgcc_s.so.1 (0x00002aaaad872000)
```
title: flags in compilers.yaml not taking effect
